In German, pronouns (I, you, he, she, etc.) change depending on their case in the sentence.

We already know ich for I and du for you. These are Nominativ cases, similarly if I or You are in Akkusativ or Dativ case they become mich and mir for Ich and dich and dir for Du . Lets see some examples:

  • German pronouns change with case: nominativ, akkusativ, dativ.
  • Know the table for ich/du/er/es/sie/wir/ihr/sie/Sie.
